programme.title: The Masked Singer S3
programme.desc: The Masked Singer is a singing competition guessing game based on the Korean format King of Mask Singer. The performers are celebrities wearing elaborate head to toe costumes to conceal their identities from the host, panelists, audience, and other contestants.

programme.title: The Weakest Link (USA)
programme.desc: Hosted by Jane Lynch, this game show sees eight contestants answer general knowledge questions to bank prize money across multiple rounds. At the end of each round, the contestants vote out who they perceive to be the "Weakest Link" until two contestants remain for the final face-off.

programme.title: Masterchef Junior USA S6
programme.desc: MasterChef Junior is an American cooking competition involving children from the ages of 8 to 13. The sixth season returns with chefs Gordon Ramsay and Christina Tosi acting as the judges, along Joe Bastianich as the third judge.

programme.title: Wheel Of Fortune S38
programme.desc: (Encore) This gameshow features a competition in which contestants solve word puzzles, similar to those used in Hangman, to win cash and prizes determined by spinning a giant carnival wheel.

programme.title: The Titan Games
programme.desc: Dwayne Johnson presents and stars in "The Titan Games," a groundbreaking new athletic competition based on Dwayne's belief that within each and every one of us is the potential for greatness.

programme.title: Earth's Great Rivers
programme.desc: Embark on the ultimate river voyage down three of the world's most epic rivers - the Amazon, the Nile and the Mississippi. This series reveals the astonishing wildlife and breathtaking landscapes of these legendary waterways from their source to their mouth. The latest technology, previously unfilmed locations and drone footage reveals their true character in a way not seen before.

programme.title: The Deep S1
programme.desc: The series follows the Nekton family, a family of adventurous underwater explorers who live aboard a state-of-the-art submarine, the Aronnax, and explore unknown areas of the Earth's oceans to unravel the mysteries of the depths.

programme.title: Crimewatch
programme.desc: Posing as an INTERPOL official from China, a scammer attempts to swindle a woman of S$200,000 as officers from the Commercial Affairs Department race against time to apprehend the perpetrators involved in the scam. In this episode, we share some tips on how to safeguard yourself from phishing scams involving delivery companies.

programme.title: Donal's Family Food In Minutes
programme.desc: With his natural charm, Donal is serving up simple, crowd-pleasing meals and snacks designed around his hectic family life which will fit easily into yours. With two young children and a busy work schedule, Donal is an expert at coming up with creative, seasonal recipes that keep the pressure off him and his wife, Sofie. He shows us fantastic recipes for spectacular Sunday roasts; time-saving tips and hacks for when you're in a rush; easily freezable bulk meals; special dinners for two.

programme.title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook: London
programme.desc: Rachel Khoo immerses herself in one of the world's most exciting food destinations - London. Always in pursuit of the perfect way to cure her food cravings, Rachel is shopping, eating and cooking her way around the capital; capturing the city's culinary inspiration like any modern food obsessive - blogging about it, snapping photos, and sketching in her trusty notebook, with the series style reflecting these influences.

programme.title: Mata Mata
programme.desc: 1949, the Japanese Occupation is over, Singapore has returned to British control, but the people are still struggling to pick up the pieces of their lives. 19 year-old Elizabeth Lee (Cheryl Wee) has just finished her Senior Cambridge exams and her mother, Yoke Lien (Aileen Tan) gives her two choices: find a job or get married. However, Elizabeth's gets into a scuffle with gangsters, catching the attention of secret society member Lim Seng Hock (Daren Tan) and British officer Henry Ridley.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Vietnam
programme.desc: Continuing in Sapa, Luke ventures beyond the main town and visits the local villages where he delves into some rich local traditions. Luke prepares a dish in the clouds with local Su May in her village, Ta Phin. Here, they cook field mushrooms gathered in the early morning.
